name: test_nested_fixtures
description:
>>> import pytest

    If we have two fixtures:
    >>> @pytest.fixture
    ... def first_fixture():
    ...     pass


    >>> @pytest.fixture
    ... def second_fixture():
    ...     pass

    And one that uses both previous:
    >>> @pytest.fixture
    ... def child_fixture(first_fixture, second_fixture):
    ...     pass

    For next test, allure report will contain all tree fixtures:
    >>> def test_nested_fixtures_example(child_fixture):
    ...     pass
descriptionHtml:
>>> import pytest

If we have two fixtures:
>>> @pytest.fixture
... def first_fixture():
...     pass


>>> @pytest.fixture
... def second_fixture():
...     pass

And one that uses both previous:
>>> @pytest.fixture
... def child_fixture(first_fixture, second_fixture):
...     pass

For next test, allure report will contain all tree fixtures:
>>> def test_nested_fixtures_example(child_fixture):
...     pass
